slam.utils package

Submodules

slam.utils.auxiliary_dataclasses module

This module contains auxiliary dataclasses that are used in the slam package.

Any dataclass that is used in multiple packages may be defined here.

class slam.utils.auxiliary_dataclasses.TimeRange(start: int, stop: int)[source]

Bases: object

Represents time range with start/stop timestamps.

start: int
stop: int
__post_init__() → None[source]

Check if the start and stop timestamps are valid.

Raises:

ValueError – If start or stop timestamp is negative or if start is greater than stop.

class slam.utils.auxiliary_dataclasses.PeriodicDataRequest(sensor: Sensor, period: TimeRange)[source]

Bases: object

A request for periodic data from a sensor with start/stop time margins.

sensor: Sensor
period: TimeRange

slam.utils.auxiliary_methods module

Auxiliary methods for the slam package.

Any method used in multiple modules/packages may be defined here.

slam.utils.auxiliary_methods.create_vector_3(x, y, z) → ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]][source]

Creates 3D float64 numpy array.

slam.utils.auxiliary_methods.create_vector_n(*args) → ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]][source]

Creates N-dimensional float64 numpy array.

slam.utils.auxiliary_methods.tuple_to_gtsam_pose3(values: tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float]) → Pose3[source]

Converts a tuple of (x, y, z, roll, pitch, yaw) to gtsam.Pose3 object.

Parameters:

values – (x, y, z, roll, pitch, yaw).

Returns:

gtsam.Pose3.

slam.utils.auxiliary_methods.as_int(value: str) → int[source]

Converts value to int.

Parameters:

value – input value.

Returns:

int value.

Raises:

ValueError – if the value can not be converted to int.

slam.utils.auxiliary_methods.check_dimensionality(array: ndarray, shape: tuple[int, ...]) → None[source]

Checks if the array has the required shape.

Parameters:

  • array – numpy array to check.

  • shape – required shape.

Raises:

DimensionalityError – if the array has wrong shape.

TODO: add tests.

slam.utils.auxiliary_methods.equal_images(imgs_1: tuple[Image, ...], imgs_2: tuple[Image, ...]) → bool[source]

Compares two items with Image data.

PIL images can not be compared directly because of different subclasses. Manually created image from numpy.array is of type Image.Image, but the one obtained from file is of type PIL.PngImagePlugin.PngImageFile.

Parameters:

  • imgs_1 – 1-st tuple with images.

  • imgs_2 – 2-nd tuple with images.

Returns:

equality result.

Raises:

DimensionalityError – if the tuples have different number of images.

slam.utils.auxiliary_methods.equal_elements(el1: Element | None, el2: Element | None) → bool[source]

Compares two elements.

If the values are of type Image, they are compared separately with equal_images() method.

Parameters:

  • el1 – 1-st element.

  • el2 – 2-nd element.

Returns:

comparison result.

slam.utils.auxiliary_methods.import_object(object_name: str, module_name: str, package_name: str) → type[source]

Imports object.

Parameters:

  • object_name – class name.

  • module_name – name of the module to import from.

  • package_name – name of the package to import a module from.

Returns:

imported object.

Raises:

  • ModuleNotFoundError – if the module is not found.

  • AttributeError – if the object is not found in the module.

slam.utils.auxiliary_methods.sort(directory: Path, key: str) → list[source]

Sorts files in a directory by name, time or size.

Parameters:

  • directory – directory to sort.

  • key – sorting key.

Returns:

sorted list of files.

Raises:

ValueError – if the key is invalid.

slam.utils.deque_set module

Deque-set data structure implementation.

Complexity:

O(1): add(), contains(item: T), remove_first(), remove_last(), __getitem__(index: int). O(N): remove(item: T)

slam.utils.deque_set.multiple(func: Callable)[source]

Decorator for multiple deque-sets.

Parameters:

func – function to be decorated.

class slam.utils.deque_set.DequeSet[source]

Bases: Generic[T]

DequeSet is a combination of set and deque.

__eq__(other: Any) → bool[source]

Compares if this DequeSet is equal to another DequeSet. Two DequeSets are equal if they have the same elements in the same order.

Parameters:

other – DequeSet to compare with.

Returns:

equality result.

property items: deque[T]

Items in deque-set.

property empty: bool

Empty status of deque-set.

add(item: T | Iterable[T]) → None[source]
Adds new item:

  1. Add to set to avoid duplicates.

  2. Add to deque for fast front-pop().

Parameters:

item – item(s) to be added.

remove(item: T) → None[source]

Removes item from set and deque.

Parameters:

item – item to be removed.

Raises:

KeyError – if item is not in deque-set.

remove_first() → None[source]

Removes first item from deque-set.

Raises:

KeyError – if deque is empty

remove_last() → None[source]

Removes last item from deque-set.

Raises:

KeyError – if deque-set is empty

sort(key: Callable, reverse: bool = False) → None[source]

Sorts deque with the given key.

Parameters:

  • key – key function to sort deque.

  • reverse – reverse sorting order.

clear() → None[source]

Clears deque-set.

slam.utils.numpy_types module

slam.utils.ordered_set module

Ordered-set data structure implementation.

Complexity:

O(1): add(), contains(item: T), remove(item), remove_first, remove_last. O(N): __getitem__(index: int).

class slam.utils.ordered_set.OrderedSet(iterable: Iterable[T] | None = None)[source]

Bases: Generic[T]

OrderedSet is a combination of set and OrderedDict.

__getitem__(index: int) → T[source]

Attention: This method requires O(n) time complexity.

Parameters:

index – index of an item.

Returns:

item.

Raises:

IndexError – if index is out of range.

__eq__(other: Any) → bool[source]

Compares if an OrderedSet is equal to another OrderedSet. Two OrderedSets are equal if they have the same elements in the same order.

Parameters:

other – OrderedSet to compare with.

Returns:

equality status.

property items

All items in OrderedSet.

property first: T

First item in OrderedSet.

Raises:

KeyError – if OrderedSet is empty.

property last: T

Last item in OrderedSet.

Raises:

KeyError – if OrderedSet is empty.

add(item: T | Iterable[T]) → None[source]

Adds an item to the OrderedSet.

Parameters:

item (T) – item(s) to be added.

Raises:

TypeError – if an item is not hashable.

remove(item: T | Iterable[T]) → None[source]

Removes an item or items from the OrderedSet.

Parameters:

item – item(s) to be removed.

Raises:

KeyError – if an item is not in the OrderedSet.

static _is_hashable(item: T) → bool[source]

Checks if an item is hashable.

Parameters:

item – item to check.

Returns:

hash ability status.
